chart_metadata.name: jellyfin
chart_metadata.description: Jellyfin is a Free Software Media System that puts you in control of managing and streaming your media.

runAsContext.description: Jellyfin runs as any non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Jellyfin

attrs.label: Published Server URL
attrs.description: Optional - The URL that Jellyfin will be advertised.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description:
Bind to the host network. While it's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>
It's required for autodiscovery to work.

attrs.description: The port for the Jellyfin Web UI.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Jellyfin.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Jellyfin.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.2.7.app_readme:
Jellyfin

Jellyfin is a Free Software Media System that puts you in control of managing and streaming your media.

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the Jellyfin directories. Afterward, the Jellyfin container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
1.2.7.detailed_readme:
Jellyfin

Jellyfin is a Free Software Media System that puts you in control of managing and streaming your media.

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the Jellyfin directories. Afterward, the Jellyfin container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). All mounted storage(s) will be chowned only if the parent directory does not match the configured user.
